definition: Patterns in sentence construction including length, complexity, and variety

positive_examples: The sentence style alternates between long periodic sentences and short punchy ones.
Cumulative sentences add detail after the main clause; periodic sentences delay the main point.
Parallel structure in sentence construction creates rhythm and emphasis.
Short sentences after long ones create emphasis: 'After all the deliberation, debate, and delay, they agreed. Finally.'
training_hints.disambiguation: Specific patterns of sentence construction, not just grammatical correctness
